channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Week: A Tragedy in Minnesota
item.description: Plus: Trump captures Maduro.

item.title: Yes, We Need a $1.5 Trillion Defense Budget
item.description: Trump’s taste for gilding everything can be over the top. It’d be a national service, though, if he manages to make the U.S. defense budget golden.

item.title: Most police forces banned shooting at moving vehicles decades ago, and Biden asked ICE to do it in 2022. So why isn’t it policy?
item.description: Decades ago, the NYPD prohibited officers from shooting at moving vehicles. It led to a drop in police killings without more danger

item.title: Trump pauses oil exec summit to peek at White House ballroom's progress
item.description: President Donald Trump paused his White House meeting with oil executives Friday to check construction progress on a new privately funded ballroom.

item.title: Here’s How Professional Activists Use Guerrilla Tactics To Sabotage ICE Arrests
item.description: Renee Good, fatally shot by an ICE agent this week in Minneapolis, was a 'warrior' for the anti-ICE group, the New York Post reports.

item.title: Reporter's Notebook: Progressives eye shutdown leverage to rein in ICE, Venezuela operations
item.description: Democrats face internal split over using funding deadline to defund ICE following Minnesota shooting, as Congress races toward January 30 shutdown.

item.title: Silicon Valley billionaire flies coach out of solidarity: ‘If I’m going to ask my employees to do it, I need to do it, too’
item.description: "Even like, yes, I have a lot of money but ... it feels like I'm out of touch," said Palmer Luckey, who set a $100k limit on his startup's salaries.
